Literature Review: Low-dimensional (L-D) ice, characterized by its unique structure, morphology, and crystal quality, has become a focal point of research due to its potential to reveal new insights into the behavior of water and ice at the nanoscale. This review aims to provide a comprehensive overview of the current understanding of L-D ice, including its crystal growth, molecular structures, phase morphologies, and physical properties, with a focus on zero-, one-, and two-dimensional (0D, 1D, and 2D) ice.
